How It Works

Cryptographic proof in three steps

Scenario: Your CFO receives a Slack message from "the CEO" requesting a $500K urgent wire transfer.

1

CFO clicks "Verify with realxreal"

One-click Slack integration. No app switching required.

2

Push notification to real CEO

"Did you request $500K wire? Approve or Deny"

3

CEO responds in 5 seconds

❌ "No, that's not me" — Fraud prevented.

Result: CFO sees alert, doesn't wire. Security team notified. $500K saved.

Powered by The Doppelgänger Protocol™

Our cryptographic protocol combines memory-based authentication with device-bound keys and biometric verification. Even if someone clones your voice and face perfectly, they can't fake your memories or access your device's secure hardware.

View Technical Docs →

Eliminating Entire Attack Classes

Attack Vector Traditional Security With realxreal
Replay Attack Deepfakes reuse recorded voices Unpredictable: memory challenge is randomly selected
OSINT Guessing Answers mined from public data Impossible: relies on private shared knowledge
Device Compromise Secrets stored in app memory Protected: critical info lives in Secure Enclave
3rd Party Data Breach Stolen credentials reused everywhere Meaningless: data is device-bound and encrypted
Man-in-the-Middle Attackers intercept or spoof media Blocked: each response is device-verified & signed

Real-time impersonation detection

Attackers can clone voices and faces, but they can't clone your shared memories. realxreal uses cryptographic challenge-response to verify identity in seconds—without storing biometrics or private data.

Privacy-First, Zero Server-Side Storage

Seamless security. Uncompromised privacy.

No Biometric Storage

We never store biometrics. Private keys live in device Secure Enclave only.

Zero-Retention

Verification challenges processed in real-time, never written to disk.

Open Source

Doppelgänger Protocol is publicly auditable. Security through transparency.

Compliance Ready

SOC 2 Type II (in progress), GDPR compliant, HIPAA-ready architecture.
